questions.question: Which tense is used in: 'They have been playing in the park since noon'?
questions.explanation: This sentence shows an action (playing) that started in the past (at noon) and is still continuing now, which is what the present perfect continuous tense is used for.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'By next summer, I _____ (learn) Spanish for two years.'
questions.explanation: This sentence is talking about an action that will be ongoing up to a point in the future, which requires the future perfect continuous tense.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the past perfect continuous tense?
options: a) I am singing in the shower.
b) I had been singing in the shower when the water went cold.
c) I will be singing in the shower.
d) I sing in the shower.
questions.explanation: This sentence uses 'had been' + the -ing form of the verb, which is the structure for past perfect continuous. It shows an action ongoing before another past event.

questions.question: 'She _____ (write) her story for three hours when her computer crashed.'
questions.explanation: This sentence describes an action that was ongoing before another past action (computer crashing), which requires the past perfect continuous tense.

questions.question: Which tense shows an action that will start later and continue up to a specific time later?
questions.explanation: The future perfect continuous tense is used for actions that will start in the future and continue up to a specific future point.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'I _____ (wait) for the bus for 30 minutes now.'
questions.explanation: This sentence describes an action that started in the past and is still ongoing, which requires the present perfect continuous tense.

questions.question: Which sentence is in the future perfect continuous tense?
options: a) I will run for an hour.
b) I had been running for an hour.
c) I have been running for an hour.
d) I will have been running for an hour by the time you arrive.
questions.explanation: This sentence uses 'will have been' + the -ing form of the verb, which is the structure for future perfect continuous.

questions.question: 'The children _____ (play) in the garden all afternoon when it started to rain.'
questions.explanation: This sentence describes an action that was ongoing before another past action (rain starting), which requires the past perfect continuous tense.

questions.question: Which tense is used to show an action that started in the past and continues now?
questions.explanation: The present perfect continuous tense is used for actions that started in the past and are still ongoing.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'By the time the movie ends, we _____ (watch) it for three hours.'
